newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian police arrest Norilsk metal theft gang.
newsitem.headline: Russian police arrest Norilsk metal theft gang.

text.p: Russia's interior ministry forces have arrested four men charged with attempting to steal precious metals produced at Norilsk Nickel's flagship plant, Interfax news agency said on Tuesday.
It said the group had attempted to export 573 kgs of scrap containing precious metal that was stolen from the plant's nickel section.

Interfax also said police had confiscated ten tonnes of scrap metal containing 127.3 kgs of palladium, 30 kgs of platinum, 8.5 kgs of gold, 134.9 kgs of silver, as well as about four tonnes of cobalt.
The metals, which the group had intended to export, were worth about seven billion roubles ($1.2 million).
Interfax said that the group was linked to five previous thefts.
The Norilsk plant belongs to the Norilsk Nickel metals group, one of the world's leading producers of nickel, platinum group metals and cobalt. --Moscow Newsroom, +7095 941 8520
